org.mundo.rt
Class BCLProvider

java.lang.Object
  org.mundo.rt.BCLProvider
All Implemented Interfaces:
IBCLProvider, IEmits
public class BCLProvider
extends java.lang.Object
implements IBCLProvider, IEmits

The Basic Communication Layer (BCL) is the most basic communication component. It is used by local services to communicate with each other within the local runtime environment. Typically, higher-level services and user programs do not interact with the BCL directly.

Author:
Erwin Aitenbichler

                 Message msg,

Sends a message to a channel. This is the main dispatch routine.

send in interface IBCLProvider
Parameters:

exclude - an optional Session to be excluded from the set of receivers.

send

public void send(Subscriber s,
                 Message msg,
                 MessageContext ctx)
Dispatches a message to the specified subscriber.

Parameters:
s - the subscriber to receive the message.
msg - the message to dispatch.
ctx - the message context which contains additional address information.

isRelevant

public boolean isRelevant(Publisher pub)
Returns whether the specified publisher is relevant. A publisher is relevant iff there exists a subscriber that is covered by the advertisement described by the publisher. This method only tests local publishers and subscribers.

Parameters:
pub - the publisher object.
Returns:
true if the specified publisher is relevant; or false otherwise.

Parameters:
signal - The signal to be checked
Returns:
true if the class emits the signal
